    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
               java.lang.Number[] v)
        Default constructor to create a Network.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
               org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
               java.lang.Integer inNodes,
               java.lang.Integer lNodes,
               java.lang.Integer outNodes,
               java.lang.Integer numEdges,
               java.lang.Integer l,
               java.lang.Double r,
               java.lang.Double s,
               java.lang.Number[] v)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the default 3-dimensional space.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
               org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
               java.lang.Integer inNodes,
               java.lang.Integer lNodes,
               java.lang.Integer outNodes,
               java.lang.Integer numEdges,
               java.lang.Integer l,
               java.lang.Double r,
               java.lang.Double s,
               java.lang.Number[] v,
               java.lang.Integer length,
               java.lang.Integer width,
               java.lang.Integer height)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the given 3-dimensional space.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.
        length - the number of available locations in the x dimension (or points along the x-axis) where the Network may place a Node.
        width - the number of available locations in the y dimension (or points along the y-axis) where the Network may place a Node.
        height - the number of available locations in the z dimension (or points along the z-axis) where the Network may place a Node.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer i,
               org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
               java.lang.Integer inNodes,
               java.lang.Integer lNodes,
               java.lang.Integer outNodes,
               java.lang.Integer numEdges,
               java.lang.Integer l,
               java.lang.Double r,
               java.lang.Double s,
               java.lang.Number[] v,
               javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gui)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the default 3-dimensional.
        Parameters:
        i - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

    • Method Detail

      • setSimulationSettings

        public void setSimulationSettings(int rounds,
                                  boolean learning)
        Store new settings to determine the type of simulation to run.
        Parameters:
        rounds - the number of iterations to run before reporting the Network's state.
        learning - whether or not learning through backpropagation should be enabled after reach round is run.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run a simulation of the behavior of the Network with the stored settings.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • learn

        public Edge[] learn(Edge[] oldLayer,
                    java.lang.Number[] targetValues,
                    java.lang.Double scale)
        Update a single given old layer/functional unit based on feedback from the change in performance at predicting given target values.
        Returns:
        the improved layer/functional unit after learning by adjusting weight according to sigmoid of performance.

      • backpropagate

        public void backpropagate()
        Send scaled feedback throughout the neural network for learning, beginning from the output layer/functional unit and ending at the initial input layer/functional unit.

      • getAdjacencyMatrix

        public java.lang.Double[][] getAdjacencyMatrix()
        Returns the adjacency matrix of this Network. adjacencyMatrix[i][j]=0 iff i=j; adjacencyMatrix[i][j]=w iff an Edge exists from i to j; adjacencyMatrix[i][j]=Double.MAX_VALUE otherwise.
        Returns:
        the adjacency matrix.

        Returns:
        the transformed data.

      • depthFirstSearch

        public java.lang.Integer[] depthFirstSearch(DirectedNode begin)
        Depth-first visiting of a node in the network. -1 means the node has not yet been visited; 0 means the node has been visited, but may have adjacent nodes that have not been visited; 1 means the node and all its neighbors have been visited. Best O(nodes + edges); average O(nodes + edges); worst O(nodes + edges)
        Returns:
        Integer[] representation of the order in which nodes were visited during the search. Each index number corresponds to the output of getNodes().
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 144

      • depthFirstSearch

        public java.lang.Double depthFirstSearch(DirectedNode begin,
                                         DirectedNode end)
        Depth-first search of the network. Best O(branching * depth); average O(branching * depth); worst O(branching * depth)
        Returns:
        Integer the distance from begin to end.
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 182.

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public java.lang.Double[] breadthFirstSearch(DirectedNode begin)
        Breadth-first search of the network.
        Returns:
        Integer[] representation of the order in which nodes were visited during the search. Each index number corresponds to the output of getNodes().
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 150. Best O(nodes + edges); average O(nodes + edges); worst O(nodes + edges)

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public java.lang.Double breadthFirstSearch(DirectedNode begin,
                                           DirectedNode end)
        Breadth-first search of the network.
        Returns:
        Integer the distance from begin to end.
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 190. Best O(branching^depth); average O(branching^depth); worst O(branching^depth)

      • dijkstraShortestPath

        public java.lang.Double[] dijkstraShortestPath(DirectedNode begin)
        Dijkstra's single-source shortest path algorithm for dense graphs.
        Returns:
        Integer[] representation of the order in which nodes were visited during the search. Each index number corresponds to the output of getNodes().
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 158. Best O(nodes^2 + edges); average O(nodes^2 + edges); worst O(nodes^2 + edges)

      • bellmanFordShortestPath

        public java.lang.Double[] bellmanFordShortestPath(DirectedNode begin)
        Bellman-Ford single-source shortest path algorithm.
        Returns:
        Integer[] representation of the order in which nodes were visited during the search. Each index number corresponds to the output of getNodes().
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 162. Best O(nodes * edges); average O(nodes * edges); worst O(nodes * edges)

      • floydWarshallShortestPath

        public void floydWarshallShortestPath(DirectedNode begin,
                                      DirectedNode end)
        Floyd-Warshall all-sources shortest path algorithm.
        See Also:
        Heineman, Pollice and Selkow, 166. Best O(nodes^3); average O(nodes^3); worst O(nodes^3)
